page.title: 02Mayfield's New Path
page.content: In Mayfield we needed a new footpath because if you wanted to walk to Middle ayfield from school you had to walk partof the way on the road.The road is narrow and very busy,so it was highly dangerous.Staffordshire County Council paid for a new footpath.It took three months to complete and it is 1160 metres long. A new post and rail fence has been built along part of the side of the path so that the farm animals are kept secure.Thorn bushes were planted too and Mr. Pinfold,a local inhabitant, has replaced some wild flowers along near the hedge.These include foxgloves,cornflowers,dog daises and vetch.The new path is very popular with those people who like to take a drink at the Rose and Crown,a pub in Middle Mayfield.
